meanings.definition: To use force or violence against someone.
meanings.sent1: He decided to touse his strength to protect his friend from harm.
meanings.sent2: The robber chose to touse his weapon to intimidate the store clerk.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain always liked to touse his power to control others.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to touse the trees, bending them with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punches were like a storm, ready to touse his opponent into submission.

meanings.definition: To handle or manipulate something roughly.
meanings.sent1: She had to touse the stubborn jar lid to open it.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to touse the rusty bolt to loosen it.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to touse the toy gently, but it broke anyway.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor had to touse the clay into the desired shape.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to touse the dough to knead it properly for baking.

meanings.definition: To work hard or labor diligently.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had to touse the fields to prepare for planting season.
meanings.sent2: She had to touse all night to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The ants continued to touse, carrying food to their nest tirelessly.
meanings.sent4: The students had to touse to understand the complex math problem.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers had to touse under the scorching sun to complete the building on time.
